posts.message:
Hello, If anyone has some experience with Mongodb 
I have 2 user and foo. 
when I create a new foo it gets a user id.
I end up with many foos belonging to the same user, I need to find a way to keep only one foo per user "keeping the 2 collections convention".

I thought of creating a cron job to find the subtraction of the two sets but I think I wrote a really slow query...

Can anyone help me for reaching a better way ?

posts.message:
i want tools to help me to take business requirements  from customer . 
for example he want notifications for some things like add new employees , edit , delete and any other notifications when he talking i think who  i organize database or add , delete , or change in tables .
usually i write this things into notes  but i don't think this is a good idea . 
i need something to manage my brain in the project :(
There was a post by a guy who wanted to teach his brother programming, now I can't find it. Did the admins remove it?

Genuine post from me Mohamed Samy and not some spam or clickbait ad.

For those learning Python/Django and if you want to create your environement on the cloud for free. This site provides a free dev environment. It also works for Ruby on Rails, Node.js, GO, PHP and Meteor.

You also get an editor in the cloud which is very sublime like.

If you use this link you get an extra 250 MB of storage and I get some extra room for my free VM too https://www.nitrous.io/join/8VJgm-zW4I4?utm_source=nitrous.io&utm_medium=copypaste&utm_campaign=referral

posts.caption: tessel.io
posts.description: Tessel is a microcontroller that runs JavaScript. It's Node-compatible and ships with Wifi built in. Use it to easily make physical devices that connect to the web.See what others have built →

posts.message: طلب صغير. لما تبقى عايز تحط كومنت أنت عارف إنه مش على موضوع البوست إطلاقا، فكر في إنك تعمل بوست جديد. و ممكن برده تحط لينك للبوست اللي أوحى لك بالموضوع لو ده سياق مهم للبداية في الكلام عن موضوعك.

posts.caption: quora.com
posts.description: Answer (1 of 29): Dynamic Programming (DP) appears to account for a plurality (some estimate up to a third) of contest problems.
